item.title: Ticket #986 (Code Cleanup: Tabs instead of Four Spaces) updated
item.dc:creator: MathiasBynens
item.description:
This should be checked over though, and not a blind search/replace. I've seen 5 spaces be used sometimes, not just 4... so if you just replaced 4 spaces, you'd be left with tab + single space.

Indeed. I actually spent an entire morning creating the patch that has now been deleted, just because of the many repetitive spaces used in functions (i.e. that have their use) and the 5 vs. 4 spaces thing. So... yeahhh.

The excellent UltraEdit-32 Text-Editor features some 1337 functions for this stuff ("Leading Spaces to Tabs", just one click on a button!).

item.title: Ticket #1705 (We have a header image generator. We should put it to work.) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: The colorpicker could be streamlined, if I may understate the situation. I looked high and low for a good JS solution and this was the most appropriate. About 60% of the color table was custom-built by me because the original was strictly web-safe.

item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: wp-content/themes/default/functions.php

item.title: colorpicker.js attached to Ticket #1705
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: wp-includes/js/colorpicker.js

item.title: Ticket #1705 (We have a header image generator. We should put it to work.) created
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
Here is a functions.php for the default theme, and a colorpicker.js to make it easy for the faint of CSS. It takes advantage of the new header-img.php for Kubrick.

This will only work on servers with the GD image library installed. It was already on my LAMP server but I had to uncomment a line in my WAMP php.ini. If GD not installed, the user will only be able to change the font color and visibility.

item.title: Ticket #1704 (Can't view post meta in admin.) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: Works for me, too. Served on LAMP and WAMP. Browsed on WinFF and WinIE. I wonder what's different. Schema?

item.title: Ticket #1704 (Can't view post meta in admin.) updated

item.description: It seem to be working okay for me. I added a couple of fields and retrieved them.

item.title: Ticket #1704 (Can't view post meta in admin.) created
item.dc:creator: JasonV
item.description: I can't seem to pull up any existing post meta in the admin, either in the normal post meta editing area or in custom form fields for plugins. I know meta exists because I double checked in the DB. Could the changes for post meta caching have broken this?

item.title: Ticket #1696 (WYSIWYG editor stripping tags) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: Cannot replicate. Could have been a transient issue. Keep in mind that wp.com is very much a work in progress, with active development. In particular, sanitization of html has been worked on, so you may have just caught it at a bad time.

item.title: kubrickheader.php attached to Ticket #1703
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: wp-content/themes/default/images/kubrickheader.php

item.title: Ticket #1703 (Kubrick could use a dynamic header image generator) created
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: At Matt's suggestion, here is a PHP script that generates a Kubrick header. It goes in the directory where kubrickheader.jpg resides. A request for kubrickheader.php or kubrickheader.php?upper=69aee7&lower=4180b6 will be served a jpg almost indistinguishable from kubrickheader.jpg. Change the upper and lower arguments to alter the gradient colors. Servers without the required GD library installed will redirect to kubrickheader.jpg.
